snippet: Under the current system, there are two levels for threats: imminent and elevated. A new level will be added to cover less serious threats, though officials declined to say what it will be called.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept announces plans to add third, and less serious, level to public warnings of terrorism; current levels cover only imminent attacks or elevated threats of such events, but new level will allow for general advisories to cover less serious terrorism-related threats.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington, and Nicholas Fandos from Sterling, Va.

lead_paragraph: Under the current system, there are two levels for threats: imminent and elevated. A new level will be added to cover less serious threats, though officials declined to say what it will be called.

headline.main: U.S. Will Add a Third Level to Warnings of Terrorism
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Add a Third Level to Warnings of Terrorism
